Module kleve.PartAndProductManager
Package kleve.PartAndProductManager

Class modifyProductController

java.lang.Object
kleve.PartAndProductManager.controllers.modifyProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class modifyProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is the controller for the Modify Product submenu. It populates the fields and tableviews with data via initialize and gives functionality to the buttons via methods.

  • Method Details

    • onSaveButtonClick

      public void onSaveButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method takes data from the menu fields, error checks it, then updates the product. It checks if the data entered in the fields is a correct corresponding format. It checks if the min is greater than the max and if the inventory value is within the min and max. Finally, it sends the user back to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This method is called when the save button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - The method can throw this error as it can fail to locate or load resources when opening a new scene.

    • onCancelButtonClick

      public void onCancelButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method returns the user to main menu.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The method is called when the cancel button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - The method can throw this error as it can fail to locate or load resources when opening a new scene.

    • onAddAPartButtonClick

      public void onAddAPartButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method error checks for no selected part then adds the selected part from the tableview to the associated parts list and therefore tableview.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This method is called when the add button is clicked. FUTURE ENHANCEMENT: This could check if the selected part is already associated and prevent duplicates of the same associated part from being added.

    • onRemoveAPartButtonClick

      public void onRemoveAPartButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method error checks for no part selected, prompts the user for a confirmation, and then removes the part selected in the tableview from the associated parts list if they selected ok.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This method is called when the remove button under the associated parts table is clicked.

    • onPartSearchFieldText

      public void onPartSearchFieldText(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method updates the part tableview by filtering it.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - This method is called when the user presses enter in the search field above the part tableview. First the method takes the text from the search field and determines if it can be parsed as an integer. If it can be parsed as an integer, it then looks up the part by the id integer. If it cannot be parsed as an integer, it then looks up the part by name using the string from the search field. The method then checks if no results were found and if so, outputs a warning message. The method then refreshes the table view to show the list of matching parts.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the fields and tableviews before this menu is displayed.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - This parameter is included as it contains the location of the FXML file that is being initialized.
      resourceBundle - This parameter provides access to localized resources which can customize the appearance of the menu. RUNTIME ERROR: It checks if the associated parts of the selected product are null. This is because setting the value of aParts to null causes an NullPointerException when trying to use it to populate the associated parts tableview. I believe this is because it becomes no longer considered an observable array list as it is initialized to be.
